name: Enoxaparin Sodium

indications.text: enoxaparin sodium injection low molecular weight heparin ( lmwh ) indicated : prophylaxis deep vein thrombosis ( dvt ) abdominal surgery , hip replacement surgery , knee replacement surgery , medical patients severely restricted mobility acute illness ( 1.1 ) inpatient treatment acute dvt without pulmonary embolism ( 1.2 ) outpatient treatment acute dvt without pulmonary embolism ( 1.2 ) prophylaxis ischemic complications unstable angina non-q-wave myocardial infarction ( myocardial infarction ) ( 1.3 ) treatment acute st-segment elevation myocardial infarction ( stemi ) managed medically subsequent percutaneous coronary intervention ( pci ) ( 1.4 )

adverseReactions: enoxaparin sodium contraindicated patients : active major bleeding history immune-mediated heparin-induced thrombocytopenia ( hit ) within past 100 days presence circulating antibodies [ ( 5.4 ) ] known hypersensitivity enoxaparin sodium ( e.g . , pruritus , urticaria , anaphylactic/anaphylactoid ) [ ( 6.2 ) ] known hypersensitivity heparin pork products
indications_original: Enoxaparin Sodium Injection is a low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) indicated for: Prophylaxis of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in abdominal surgery, hip replacement surgery, knee replacement surgery, or medical patients with severely restricted mobility during acute illness ( 1.1 ) Inpatient treatment of acute DVT with or without pulmonary embolism ( 1.2 ) Outpatient treatment of acute DVT without pulmonary embolism ( 1.2 ) Prophylaxis of ischemic complications of unstable angina and non-Q-wave myocardial infarction (MI) ( 1.3 ) Treatment of acute ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) managed medically or with subsequent percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) ( 1.4 )
contraindications_original: See full prescribing information for dosing and administration information. ( 2 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Enoxaparin Sodium Injection, USP is supplied in two concentrations (see table 26 and 27).
                  
                     Table 26: 100 mg per mL Concentration
                  
                  
                     
                     
                     
                     
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           * Strength represents the number of milligrams of enoxaparin sodium in Water for Injection. Enoxaparin Sodium Injection, USP 30 mg and 40 mg prefilled syringes, and 60 mg, 80 mg, and 100 mg graduated prefilled syringes each contain 10 mg enoxaparin sodium per 0.1 mL Water for Injection.
                        
                        
                           
                              †Approximate anti-Factor Xa activity based on reference to the W.H.O. First International Low Molecular Weight Heparin Reference Standard.
   
    
                        
                        
                           
                              ‡Each Enoxaparin Sodium Injection, USP prefilled syringe is for single, one-time use only and is affixed with a 27 gauge x 1/2 inch needle.

adverseReactions_original:
Enoxaparin sodium is contraindicated in patients with:
                  
                     Active major bleeding
                     History of immune-mediated heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) within the past 100 days or in the presence of circulating antibodies
  
   [see Warnings and Precautions (
   
    5.4)]
  
   
                     
                     Known hypersensitivity to enoxaparin sodium (e.g., pruritus, urticaria, anaphylactic/anaphylactoid reactions)
  
   [see Adverse Reactions (
   
    6.2)]
  
   
                     
                     Known hypersensitivity to heparin or pork products
